notes: First reference to Dan being a baby.  Erin calls him a cloud baby.  He crawls under his blanket, holds it up to his chin, and makes a baby face.  He says Erin makes a face that's half horror, half orgasm.

Dan got good news from his doctor.  He said he's in perfect physical condition, so now what's left but to kill himself?  There will be laser spiders to repair me.  JEFF: There will be diabetes.  It's an adult onset condition!
Dan went to San Francisco and Chicago where he saw a Morgan Freeman like man talking.  He was a bad clarinet player.  Jeff tells a story of going to France and seeing a bad clarinetist.
Dan and Jeff talk about traffic jams and bad traffic after 9/11.

Dan rants on Obama vs. Romney.  "Politics turns us all into fascists," he says.  "Of course Obama is a better president than Romney, but that's like saying Diet Pepsi is better than piss.  What we need is water.  Don't make me choose between Pepsi and Coke, because you're just pushing corn syrup."
Greg Proops talks about other DND podcasts.
What did we learn?  Jen: Examine before you fight!  [TITLE]
Dan went to Chicago for the Hugo Awards, because Community was nominated.
Dan talks about his TV deals with CBS and FOX.
DAN: You can't go back to high school again and be cool.  It's not empirical.
Daniel from the audience asks about Nike sponsorship.  Dan and Jeff pivot to take another tack when another audience member asks if Ketel One is his drink of choice, or for bulk drinking.
Dino's daughter got stung by a stingray, a jellyfish, and got her finger ground by a meat grinder, scraped her face, and got in a car accident.
Dan praises Final Destination movie.  Jeff lambastes martyrs.  Dan on Sam Peckinpah: a case for rape.

Dan talks about the phenomenon of wearing out a song.  Like Rock Star, like the Yeah Yeah Yeahs, "Wait, they don't love you like I do."  He's reminded of when his parents split and his dad played Turn Around Bright Eyes over and over again.  Jeff: A total eclipse of the heart.

Dan does a Johnny Cash song singalong.

DAN: "I'm sorry this show was bad.
I'm sorry it was bad.
I'm sorry it went lower,
and that I rhymed bad with bad.
I guarantee this won't be a closer
because it's impossible to rhyme with negativity."

JEFF: Nativity.

Dan takes a couple questions from the audience to feed some improv.

He asks Andy what his favorite comfort food his: Steak!

He asks Jason what his least favorite food is: Seafood.

He then improvises a movie using those foods to close out the show.
